item.title: Vince McMahon's life after WWE: Kittens, vacations and staying in touch with Trump
item.dc:creator: Chloe Melas and Alex Sherman, CNBC and Tom Winter
item.description: Vince McMahon is facing a federal investigation and accusations of sexual abuse, but some of those close to him say he’s unfazed. WWE is moving on.

media:content.media:text: Photo Illustration: Vince McMahon and WWE Headquarters
media:content.media:description: Following his resignation as executive chairman of WWE parent company TKO Group amid a lawsuit accusing him of sex abuse, Vince McMahon has been spending time traveling, eating out and keeping in touch with friends.
Vince McMahon, Stephanie McMahon and Triple H attend the UFC 276 event at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas on July 2, 2022.

media:content.media:text: Vince McMahon speaks to an audience during a WWE fan appreciation event in Hartford, Conn. on Oct. 30, 2010.
media:content.media:description: Vince McMahon speaks at a WWE fan appreciation event in Hartford, Conn., on Oct. 30, 2010.

media:content.media:text: Vince McMahon gets more than he bargained for when Donald Trump got physical after signing the contract for Wrestlemania XXIII's \"Hair vs Hair\" match at Monday Night RAW in Washington on March 12, 2007.
media:content.media:description: Vince McMahon got more than he bargained for when Donald Trump got physical after signing the contract for Wrestlemania XXIII's "Hair vs. Hair" match in Washington on March 12, 2007.
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, Vince McMahon and John Cena attend the WrestleMania 29 news conference at Radio City Music Hall in New York on April 4, 2013.
Stephanie McMahon in the ring during Night Two of WrestleMania 40 at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia on April 7.
WWE headquarters in Stamford, Conn., on Jan. 31, 2022.

item.title: Senate quickly votes to dismiss impeachment articles against DHS Secretary Mayorkas
item.dc:creator: Scott Wong and Frank Thorp V and Ryan Nobles and Julia Jester and Caryn Littler and Julie Tsirkin
item.description: The trial lasted just a few hours, with Democrats and some Republicans saying the Homeland Security secretary hadn’t committed an impeachable offense.

media:content.media:text: Alejandro Mayorkas speaks during a hearing
media:content.media:description: Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro Mayorkas at a hearing on Capitol Hill in 2021.

item.title: An oncology nurse and a man with 'no spare time': Meet the first 7 jurors of Trump’s hush money trial
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Shabad and Nigel Chiwaya
item.description: The initial seven jurors were chosen for former President Donald Trump's hush money trial on Tuesday after confirming their ability to deliver a fair verdict to both sides.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump sits in the courtroom
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump waits for the start of the second day of jury selection in his criminal trial at Manhattan criminal court on Tuesday.

item.title: USC cancels commencement speech by class valedictorian
item.description: The University of Southern California, citing security concerns related to the Israel-Hamas war, canceled the commencement speech by class valedictorian Asna Tabassum, following complaints of "anti-semetic" content on one of her social media pages. Tabassum claimed USC "is succumbing to a campaign of hate meant to silence my voice." NBC News' Liz Kreutz reports.

media:content.media:title: USC cancels commencement speech by class valedictorian
media:content.media:description: The University of Southern California, citing security concerns related to the Israel-Hamas war, canceled the commencement speech by class valedictorian Asna Tabassum, following complaints of "anti-semetic" content on one of her social media pages. Tabassum claimed USC "is succumbing to a campaign of hate meant to silence my voice." NBC News' Liz Kreutz reports.

item.title: House Republicans release aid bills for Israel and Ukraine, eyeing weekend House votes
item.dc:creator: Sahil Kapur and Rebecca Kaplan and Julie Tsirkin
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson announced he will roll out four bills to provide U.S. aid to Ukraine, Israel and other allies, with plans to vote this weekend.

media:content.media:description: House Speaker Mike Johnson faces a big test this week.

item.title: Wisconsin man accused of killing, dismembering woman while on a date
item.dc:creator: Antonio Planas
item.description: Authorities accused a man of killing and dismembering a 19-year-old Milwaukee woman with whom he was on a date, court records show.

media:content.media:description: Sade Robinson.

item.title: Lawyers for man accused of murdering four Idaho students submit his alibi
item.description: Lawyers for Bryan Kohberger, the man accused of stabbing four Idaho college students to death, have formally released his alibi. Kohberger's attorneys plan to offer testimony from an expert to prove his cellphone was not in the area at the time of the killing.

media:content.media:title: Lawyers for man accused of murdering four Idaho students submit his alibi
media:content.media:description: Lawyers for Bryan Kohberger, the man accused of stabbing four Idaho college students to death, have formally released his alibi. Kohberger's attorneys plan to offer testimony from an expert to prove his cellphone was not in the area at the time of the killing.

item.title: Rep. Donald Payne remains hospitalized after 'cardiac episode' more than a week ago
item.dc:creator: Kyle Stewart and Zoë Richards
item.description: A new statement from the New Jersey Democrat's office paints a different picture than the one put out last week, and his absence could affect tight votes on the House floor.

media:content.media:description: Rep. Donald Payne Jr., D-N.J., at the U.S. Capitol, on Jan. 30.

item.title: No charges for Los Angeles officer who shot and killed teen in dressing room
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: LOS ANGELES — The California Attorney General declined to file criminal charges against a Los Angeles police officer who fired a rifle at a suspect inside a clothing store in 2021, killing a 14-year-old girl in a dressing room, authorities said Wednesday.

media:content.media:description: Valentina Orellana-Peralta.

item.title: Cheech Marin draws on the discrimination his WWII veteran dad faced for his new movie role
item.dc:creator: Arturo Conde
item.description: Comedian, actor and activist Cheech Marin drew on his father's experiences as a World War II veteran for his role in the movie "The Long Game," about an underdog Mexican American high school golf team in Texas and the racism they and their coach faced.

media:content.media:description: Cheech Marin said that when his Mexican American father returned from World War II, "he wasn’t accepted in a lot of employable positions.”

item.title: L.A. police chief says officer shortage makes it harder to respond to some calls
item.description: Los Angeles is among cities nationwide trying to deal with shortages of police officers in their ranks. LAPD Interim Police Chief Dominic Choi says while emergency calls like crimes in progress have not been affected, non-emergency response times have grown. NBC News' Lester Holt reports.

media:content.media:title: L.A. police chief says officer shortage makes it harder to respond to some calls
media:content.media:description: Los Angeles is among cities nationwide trying to deal with shortages of police officers in their ranks. LAPD Interim Police Chief Dominic Choi says while emergency calls like crimes in progress have not been affected, non-emergency response times have grown. NBC News' Lester Holt reports.

item.title: DATELINE SUNDAY PREVIEW: Even the Devil Went to Church
item.description: Andrea Canning reports Sunday, April 21 at 10/9c on NBC.

media:content.media:title: DATELINE SUNDAY PREVIEW: Even the Devil Went to Church

item.title: India kicks off the world’s largest elections this week. Here’s what you need to know
item.dc:creator: Charmaine Jacob, CNBC and Joanna Tan, CNBC
item.description: Indians head to the polls Friday in the world’s largest democratic election, as almost a billion voters decide whether to re-elect Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

media:content.media:text: Indians head to the polls on Friday in what will be the world’s largest democratic election, as close to one billion voters pick their next government and decide whether to hand Prime Minister Narendra Modi a third term in office.
media:content.media:description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at an election campaign event in Chennai on April 9.

item.title: China slams U.S. probe into its shipbuilding industry, calling it a ‘mistake on top of a mistake’
item.dc:creator: Sheila Chiang, CNBC
item.description: China said it “firmly opposes” the U.S. investigation into its maritime, logistics and shipbuilding industries, calling it a “mistake on top of a mistake.”

media:content.media:text: Ship Repair Underway In Guangzhou's Shipyard
media:content.media:description: Workers hoist a propeller at a COSCO shipyard in Guangzhou, China, last month.

item.title: Man arrested, accused of throwing pipe bomb at Satanic Temple in Massachusetts
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: An Oklahoma man was arrested after authorities accused him of throwing a pipe bomb at the Massachusetts headquarters of a group called The Satanic Temple.

media:content.media:text: A man stands on a later outside the Satanic Temple where a "Hell House" was being held in Salem, Massachusett on October 8, 2019. - The Hell House was a paradoy on a Christian Conversion center meant to scare atheist and other Satanic Church members.
media:content.media:description: A man stands on a ladder outside the Satanic Temple in Salem, Mass., in 2019.

item.title: Biden mischaracterizes his uncle's disappearance during World War II
item.dc:creator: Megan Lebowitz
item.description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday mischaracterized the circumstances of his uncle's death during World War II as he lambasted former President Donald Trump's comments about the military.

media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden speaks to members of the United Steel Workers Union in Pittsburgh on Wednesday.

item.title: Stephen Curry and wife Ayesha planned new baby around Paris Olympics
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Golden State guard Stephen Curry knew he was running out of chances to play in what would be his first Olympics, so he and his wife Ayesha started planning many months ago about how to make the Paris Games work for their family.

media:content.media:text: nba basketball player stephen curry wife Ayesha
media:content.media:description: Stephen Curry with his wife Ayesha at the premiere of the film at the 2023 Sundance Film Festival, in Park City, Utah, on Jan. 23, 2023.
Stephen Curry of the Golden State Warriors goes up for a shot against the Sacramento Kings in Sacramento, Calif., on Tuesday.

item.title: USC decision to cancel Muslim valedictorian's speech further inflames tensions on campus
item.dc:creator: Alicia Victoria Lozano
item.description: University of Southern California students said their hopes were dashed this week when the school canceled Muslim student Asna Tabassum 's commencement address.

media:content.media:description: Students on campus at the University of Southern California (USC) in Los Angeles, on April 16, 2024.
Asna Tabassum, a graduating senior, on the USC campus, on Tuesday.

item.title: Teacher at New England boarding school accused of preying on female students
item.dc:creator: Corky Siemaszko
item.description: A veteran teacher at an upper-crust Massachusetts boarding and day school for girls has resigned amid allegations that he groomed several students for sex during the 30-plus years he taught at Miss Hall’s School.

media:content.media:text: Miss Hall's School in Pittsfield, Mass.
media:content.media:description: Miss Hall's School in Pittsfield, Mass.

item.title: Biden chokes up while talking about deceased son and Trump's disparaging remarks about service members
item.dc:creator: Elyse Perlmutter-Gumbiner and Ghael Fobes and Olympia Sonnier
item.description: “That man doesn’t deserve to have been the commander in chief for my son, my uncle,” he said, referring to Beau Biden and Ambrose Finnegan who both served in the military.

media:content.media:text: President Joe Biden speaks during an event
media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden at the United Steelworkers Headquarters in Pittsburgh on April 17, 2024.

item.title: Senior NPR editor resigns after accusing outlet of liberal bias
item.dc:creator: Daysia Tolentino
item.description: Uri Berliner, who worked as a senior business editor at NPR, wrote an essay for The Free Press in which he said he believes NPR is losing the public’s trust.

Uri Berliner in 2017.

item.title: How one Democrat is trying to maintain Trump country appeal: From the Politics Desk
item.dc:creator: The Politics Desk
item.description: Democratic Sen. Tammy Baldwin is trying ti maintain her appeal in rural Wisconsin ahead of a tough re-election battle with Donald Trump on the ballot.
